page.title: 04BUCKLAND NEWTON NEWS
page.content: :::::::::5th-11th June 1985::::::::::: BLACK OUT: A power cut in Buckland Newton, according to the Southern Electricity Board was caused by a bull leaning against a pole. After an hour, power was restored.FOR SALE: PART HIGHER FARM, BUCKLAND NEWTON, DORCHESTER, DORSET.Parcels of pasture land with generous milk quota. 64 acres in 5 lots to be auctioned at "The Three Choughs Hotel", Yeovil.A HAPPY ENDING: A local personality and president of a golf course died talking about his favorite sport, golf. For the first time in months he had managed to play 18 holes. DORCHESTER AND DISTRICT EVENING CRICKET LEAGUE: 2 matches were played on the Parish Fields at Buckland Newton. The Rugby Club wre all out for 46 runs leaving B.N. winners with 94 runs.
